channel.title: Default prioritize .onion sites
channel.description:
Hi everyone,
I'm using Whonix on Qubes and I'm trying to set the preference "Prioritize .onion sites when known" on Always by default.
I succeeded in setting the security slider on safest by default by adding "*tb_security_slider_safest=true*" in the *50_user.conf* file but I'm missing the config string for the .onion sites prioritization.
Anyone knows which string to use?
Thanks!

item.title: Default prioritize .onion sites
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
mrsmith:

I succeeded in setting the security slider on safest by default by adding “tb_security_slider_safest=true” in the 50_user.conf file

For current status (and unlikely to ever change), see:
https://github.com/Whonix/tb-starter/blob/master/etc/torbrowser.d/30_default.conf#L44

Read full topic

item.title: Default prioritize .onion sites
item.dc:creator: mrsmith
item.description:
Hi everyone,

I’m using Whonix on Qubes and I’m trying to set the preference “Prioritize .onion sites when known” on Always by default.

I succeeded in setting the security slider on safest by default by adding “tb_security_slider_safest=true” in the 50_user.conf file but I’m missing the config string for the .onion sites prioritization.

Anyone knows which string to use?

Thanks!
